SEARCH
Package qupath.ext.py4j.core

Class QuPathEntryPoint

java.lang.Object
qupath.lib.scripting.QP
qupath.lib.gui.scripting.QPEx
qupath.ext.py4j.core.QuPathEntryPoint
Direct Known Subclasses:
QuPathFX
public class QuPathEntryPoint extends QPEx
Entry point for use with a Py4J Gateway. This provides useful methods to work with QuPath from Python.

  • Field Summary

    • getMeasurementTable

      public static String getMeasurementTable(ImageData<?> imageData, Collection<? extends PathObject> pathObjects)
      Return the measurement table in as a single tab-delimited string. This is equivalent to joining all the rows provided by getMeasurementTableRows(ImageData, Collection) with newline characters.

      Note that this may fail for very large tables, because the length of the text exceeds the maximum length of a Java String. In this case, using getMeasurementTableRows(ImageData, Collection) is preferable, or alternatively pass fewer objects to measure.

      Parameters:
      imageData - the image containing the measurements to retrieve
      pathObjects - the objects containing the measurements to retrieve
      Returns:
      a string representation of the measurement table
      See Also:
      • getMeasurementTableRows(ImageData, Collection)

    • getMeasurementTableRows

      public static List<String> getMeasurementTableRows(ImageData<?> imageData, Collection<? extends PathObject> pathObjects)
      Return the measurement table in a list of tab-delimited strings.

      The first item corresponds to the header, while the rest correspond to objects in the provided collection.

      Parameters:
      imageData - the image containing the measurements to retrieve
      pathObjects - the objects containing the measurements to retrieve
      Returns:
      a list of strings representing the measurement table
      See Also:
      • getMeasurementTable(ImageData, Collection)

    • toFeatureCollection

      public static String toFeatureCollection(Collection<? extends PathObject> pathObjects)
      Convert a collection of PathObjects to a GeoJSON FeatureCollection. If there is a chance the resulting string will be too long, prefer instead toFeatureCollections(Collection, int) to partition objects into separate feature collections.
      Parameters:
      pathObjects - the PathObjects to convert
      Returns:
      a GeoJSON FeatureCollection representing the provided PathObjects

    • toFeatureCollections

      public static List<String> toFeatureCollections(Collection<? extends PathObject> pathObjects, int chunkSize)
      Convert a collection of PathObjects to GeoJSON FeatureCollections, partitioning into separate collections. This can be useful for performance reasons, and also to avoid the character limit for strings in Java and Python.
      Parameters:
      pathObjects - the PathObjects to convert
      chunkSize - the size of each partition
      Returns:
      a list of GeoJSON FeatureCollection representing the provided PathObjects

    • toGeoJsonFeatureList

      public static List<String> toGeoJsonFeatureList(Collection<? extends PathObject> pathObjects)
      Convert a collection of PathObjects to a list of GeoJSON objects.
      Parameters:
      pathObjects - the PathObjects to convert
      Returns:
      a list of GeoJSON features representing the provided PathObjects

    • getTiffStack

      public static byte[] getTiffStack(ImageServer<BufferedImage> server, double downsample) throws IOException
      Get a hyperstack of an entire image at the provided downsample.
      Parameters:
      server - the image to open
      downsample - the downsample to use when reading the image
      Returns:
      a TIFF encoded array of bytes corresponding to the hyperstack
      Throws:
      IOException - when an error occurs while reading the image

    • getTiffStack

      public static byte[] getTiffStack(ImageServer<BufferedImage> server, double downsample, int x, int y, int width, int height) throws IOException
      Get a hyperstack of a portion of an image at the provided downsample.
      Parameters:
      server - the image to open
      downsample - the downsample to use when reading the image
      x - the x-coordinate of the portion of the image to retrieve
      y - the y-coordinate of the portion of the image to retrieve
      width - the width of the portion of the image to retrieve
      height - the height of the portion of the image to retrieve
      Returns:
      a TIFF encoded array of bytes corresponding to the hyperstack
      Throws:
      IOException - when an error occurs while reading the image

    • getTiffStack

      public static byte[] getTiffStack(ImageServer<BufferedImage> server, double downsample, int x, int y, int width, int height, int z, int t) throws IOException
      Get a hyperstack of an image for a specific region, using all z-slices and time points from 0 to the ones specified in the parameters.
      Parameters:
      server - the image to open
      downsample - the downsample to use when reading the image
      x - the x-coordinate of the portion of the image to retrieve
      y - the y-coordinate of the portion of the image to retrieve
      width - the width of the portion of the image to retrieve
      height - the height of the portion of the image to retrieve
      z - the z-stacks 0 to this parameter will be retrieved
      t - the time points 0 to this parameter will be retrieved
      Returns:
      a TIFF encoded array of bytes corresponding to the hyperstack
      Throws:
      IOException - when an error occurs while reading the image

    • getTiffStack

      public static byte[] getTiffStack(ImageServer<BufferedImage> server, RegionRequest request) throws IOException
      Get a hyperstack of an image for a specific region, using all z-slices and time points from 0 to the ones specified in the provided RegionRequest.
      Parameters:
      server - the image to open
      request - the region to read. All z-stacks from 0 to ImageRegion.getZ() and time points from 0 to ImageRegion.getT() will be retrieved
      Returns:
      a TIFF encoded array of bytes corresponding to the hyperstack
      Throws:
      IOException - when an error occurs while reading the image

    • getImageBytes

      public static byte[] getImageBytes(ImageServer<BufferedImage> server, double downsample, String format) throws IOException
      Read the first z-slice and first time point of the provided image at the provided downsample and return an image with the provided format.
      Parameters:
      server - the image to open
      downsample - the downsample to use when reading the image
      format - the format the result should have
      Returns:
      an array of bytes described the requested image with the provided format
      Throws:
      IOException - when an error occurs while reading the image

    • getImageBytes

      public static byte[] getImageBytes(ImageServer<BufferedImage> server, double downsample, int x, int y, int width, int height, String format) throws IOException
      Read the first z-slice and first time point of a portion of the provided image at the provided downsample and return an image with the provided format.
      Parameters:
      server - the image to open
      downsample - the downsample to use when reading the image
      x - the x-coordinate of the portion of the image to retrieve
      y - the y-coordinate of the portion of the image to retrieve
      width - the width of the portion of the image to retrieve
      height - the height of the portion of the image to retrieve
      format - the format the result should have
      Returns:
      an array of bytes described the requested image with the provided format
      Throws:
      IOException - when an error occurs while reading the image

    • getImageBytes

      public static byte[] getImageBytes(ImageServer<BufferedImage> server, double downsample, int x, int y, int width, int height, int z, int t, String format) throws IOException
      Read a portion of the provided image at the provided downsample and return an image with the provided format.
      Parameters:
      server - the image to open
      downsample - the downsample to use when reading the image
      x - the x-coordinate of the portion of the image to retrieve
      y - the y-coordinate of the portion of the image to retrieve
      width - the width of the portion of the image to retrieve
      height - the height of the portion of the image to retrieve
      z - the z-slice of the image to retrieve
      t - the time point of the image to retrieve
      format - the format the result should have
      Returns:
      an array of bytes described the requested image with the provided format
      Throws:
      IOException - when an error occurs while reading the image

    • getImageBytes

      public static byte[] getImageBytes(ImageServer<BufferedImage> server, RegionRequest request, String format) throws IOException
      Read a portion of the provided image and return an image with the provided format.
      Parameters:
      server - the image to open
      request - the region to read.
      format - the format the result should have
      Returns:
      an array of bytes described the requested image with the provided format
      Throws:
      IOException - when an error occurs while reading the image

    • getImageBase64

      public static String getImageBase64(ImageServer<BufferedImage> server, double downsample, String format) throws IOException
      Same as getImageBytes(ImageServer, double, String), but encoded with the Base64 scheme.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getImageBase64

      public static String getImageBase64(ImageServer<BufferedImage> server, double downsample, int x, int y, int width, int height, String format) throws IOException
      Same as getImageBytes(ImageServer, double, int, int, int, int, String), but encoded with the Base64 scheme.
      Throws:
      IOException

      public static String getImageBase64(ImageServer<BufferedImage> server, RegionRequest request, String format) throws IOException

    • getImageBytes

      public static byte[] getImageBytes(BufferedImage image) throws IOException
      Convert a BufferedImage to an array of bytes. If the image is RGB, the format of the returned image is PNG. Otherwise, it's "imagej tiff".
      Parameters:
      image - the image to convert
      Returns:
      an array of bytes corresponding to the provided image
      Throws:
      IOException - when an error occurs while reading the image

    • getImageBytes

      public static byte[] getImageBytes(BufferedImage image, String format) throws IOException
      Convert a BufferedImage to an array of bytes with the provided format.
      Parameters:
      image - the image to convert
      format - the format of the returned image
      Returns:
      an array of bytes corresponding to the provided image
      Throws:
      IOException - when an error occurs while reading the image
